titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. IV:30. Friday.

list.item: Petn. R. E. Orne Master of Barque Cavelier of Salem, for remission of penalty for excess of 2 passengers from Havre to New-York.
Let the penalty be remitted on paymt of all charges
Ches: & Ohio Canal. through W. City.

div.p: 2. IV:30. Shower and Tub Bath
3. IV:30. Sunday— Baths

list.item: Matthew 6.9. Our father which art in heaven

div.p: 4. IV:30. Monday Tub Bath

list.item: Ride with Mr Frye & John to Graeff’s— Ladd’s—

div.p: 5. IV:30. Ride to Baltimore.

list.item: numerous visitors— Meeting in the Square.

div.p: 6. IV:15.— From Baltimore to Philadelphia.

list.item: Steam Boat United States Captain Trippe to Frenchtown
Steam-boat Delaware, Captain Jenkins. to Philadelphia.
Philadelphia at 7. Head’s Mansion House— Visitors.
J. Sergeant— W. Jones— Jos. Randall— E. Ingersoll— and numbers.

div.p: 7. V:15. Thursday— from Philadelphia to New-Brunswick

list.item: Steam-Boat to Trenton— Passengers landed 7 miles above—
Bishop White— Chauncey— J. Connell— his Son—
Ride to Kingston 14. Miles.— dined at 4.

div.p: 8. V. Friday— From New-Brunswick to New-York

list.item: John came with the Carriage and Horses to Elizabethtown, and thence in Steam-boat to the City.
Commodore Chauncey— Captain Patterson. T. Bailey— P. Stagg.
Burns, Stone— Sidney Brooks, Mr Davis— Ride with them after dinner— Tea at Mr S. Brooks’s
Invitation to remain some days at New-York—declined.
Mrs Sarah Adams, my brother Charles’s widow, died at Utica last Saturday the 3d. Announced in the Newspapers here—

div.p: 9. V:15. Saturday— From— New-York— Long-Island Sound—

list.item: G. Thorburn— 67. Liberty-Street— Seedsman—went to his Shop—
went on board the Hudson frigate— Sloop of War Fairfield— Captn Parker.
Steam-Frigate Fulton— Frigate Sabine building at the Yard— visit to Mrs Chauncey.
Steam-boat Linnaeus. Captain Peck to Flushing— Young Prince
H. Lynch— Visit to Prince’s Garden— Peck’s Hotel
From Steam-boat Linnaeus to H. Lynch’s Boat—landed at his House
Dined at H Lynch’s—his family—two brother’s—daughters— Mrs Lee—
Embarked at 4:30. in Steam-boat Chancellor Livingston, Captn Coggeshall

div.p: 10. V:15. Sunday— Providence— Walpole.

list.item: Fog in the Night and this Morning—detained us four hours.
Newport at 8. A.M. D. J. Pearce— A. Robbins— Collins
Providence at 11— Franklin House— Many visitors.
Fenner— Eldridge— Pitman— Eddy. &c Parmenter and Smith
Ride to Walpole—21. Miles— Smith with us— Lodge at Fuller’s 9:20.

div.p: 11. V. Monday— From Walpole to Quincy.

list.item: Rode to Dedham 11. Miles— Breakfast at Bride’s.
9. Miles to Quincy—arrived at Noon— Bath at the wharf.
D. Webster, Jos. S. Johnston— B. Bussey Dexter here.
Walk with Mr Frye to the Temple
My Sons George and Charles— Degrand. J. Marston— L. C. Smith.

div.p: 12. V. Tuesday.— Bath at the wharf

list.head:
At the Probate Court—returned an Acct. as Exors. of J. Adams—
Dined at B. Busseys— Jamaica Plains— J. S. & Mrs Johnston— D. Webster. E. Everett J. Amory— Jos. Head— I. P. Davis Mrs Holley &c— Home at 8. P.M.

div.p: 13. V. Wednesday—

list.item: Mr Frye and John went to Boston—

div.p: 14. V:15. Thursday. Unwell.

list.item: Ride to Randolph with G. W. A. and J. Q. A.

div.p: 15. V. Friday—

list.item: Ride to the Railway— Met J. Bailey.
Ride to the encampment of the Boston Chapman rifle Rangers— H. G. Otis.

div.p: 16. V:10. George and Charles to Boston

list.item: Order for discharge from prison of Elijah Loveleh. Washington County D.C. confined for refusing to aid a Constable.
Bath— Dined with John at Mr Quincy’s

div.p: 17. V:15. Sunday.

list.item: Heard Mr Flint of Cohassett— 1. Thess: 2.12. Matt. 24.23.24
Smith— Isaac Revd. to dine— George out from Boston.
Ride with G. W. and J. Q. A. to Mr Bailey’s— Dorchester

div.p: 18. V. Monday—

list.item: symbols to Boston— Charles’s birth day
Ride over rocks and wilds to Randolph.

div.p: 19. V:15 Tuesday
20. V. Wednesday.— Bath

list.head:
Charles to Boston—
With my brother and John, dined at Genl. H. A. S. Dearborns Roxbury.

div.p: 21. V. Thursday— Cohasset.
Ride with my brother to Warrock’s tavern, Cohasset— John and J. Q. A in the Carriage— 10 Miles—from 7 to 8:30.

The party consisted of T. B. Adams— John Adams, J. Q. Adams junr. G. W. Beale. Thomas Greenleaf. Daniel Greenleaf, Gourgas Loring— John Marston, Wales, Peter Whitney, George Whitney, John Whitney— Edward Miller and W. Smith.
We passed on the road Quincy Thaxter, making Stone Wall—

My brother, T. Greenleaf, G. W. Beale, and I went out in a leaky boat rowed by a Mr Beales, and fished, about 3. miles, from the beach from 9 till 2— Fine weather but little success— The chief prize a huge Skate, hooked by T. Greenleaf— Cod, Rock Cod, Flounders, large Perch, one Pollock, and Sculpins—
Dined at 3. Chowder and a good dinner— Played 3 Games, all lost at Bowls after dinner— Rode home from 5:30 to 7— Charles from Boston—
Isaac Smith, Louisa, Mrs Hall & W. Greenleaf here—
22. V. Friday.— Bath with symbols

list.item: Evening visits to Mr J. Greenleaf’s

div.p: 23. Saturday— Bath symbols

Went to Boston with John— Stopped at the State House and viewed Chantrey’s Statue of Washington— Call at Judge Joseph Hall’s— He went with me to the Athenaeum Gallery of Stewart’s paintings— 214. Portraits of very various merit— Mrs H. G. Otis, Mrs T. L. Winthrop, Mrs. Jos. Russell— Mrs Morton— My Father (the last of him that he painted)— H. G. Otis Jonn. Mason, Col T. Dawes, his son Judge Dawes, Genl. H. Dearborn, Mr Salisbury my own heads Israel Thorndike, are among many fine portraits and likenesses— The five Presidents which he painted for Daggett, are worse than indifferent, and generally those of the last ten years are far inferior to the others. Mr Jones told me of a Portrait of my father by Brown, which was in the Collection of Mr Jefferson and now in Jones’s possession—

Dined at Mr Gardner Greene’s, a company of 23. persons— My three Sons there. P. C. Brooks, S. Appleton, Genl. Morton, I. Parker Josiah and Edmund Quincy, R. G. Amory, B. Joy, J. Hubbard, Jos Russell, T. L. Winthrop— Mrs Greene two Sons and a daughter
Returned to Quincy in the Evening with my Sons George and John
Isaac Hull came out from Boston— Charles went to Medford.
Mr Brooks invited me to Medford— I engaged to go next Saturday.
24. V. Sunday—

list.item: Heard Mr Cutler— 12th. Sunday after Trinity— Romans 8–26.
Evening bath with G. W. and J. Q.

div.p: 25. V. Monday— Creek Bath— Fahrenheit 98. Congress Water.

list.item: Viewed the grounds with Mr Vesey.
Decision in the case of Captain Elijah Boardman
Aid to Govr Taylor of S.C.

div.p: 26. V. Tuesday— Springtide Bath. School of Boys

list.item: Richardson— Joseph— Pension Law— Custom House Credits
Bath at the Creek with George at Noon—
Afternoon Ride to Jamaica Plains— Nathl. Curtis Mr Boylston’s Will.
Alighted at Dr Welsh’s Boston— Harriet and the Doctor— Mrs Bailey’s daughter— T. Welsh’s two Sons, Charles & Thomas
Lodge at Hamilton’s Exchange Hotel— Letter to R. Rush.
Petition of Thaxter Prince, Master of the American Barque the Oxford— Remission of penalty for excess of 5 passengers from Havre to New-York— Order for remission upon payment of Costs.

div.p: 27. V:30. Wednesday— Commencement— Cambridge—

list.item: Cambridge with George— Met the Company in Hollis Hall
professor Ware presiding— Procession to the Meeting House
Andrew Stevenson, Speaker H.R.U.S. walked with me—
Performances from half past 9 till 3— Winthrop, Emerson, Hillard— For 2d. Degree— Chapman, Whitman—
Procession to Holworthy Hall— Dinner 78th. Psalm sung 4. verses tune of Old Hundred— A. Stevenson, Edward Coles, George Tucker
Dr. M’Vicker of Columbia College New-York there.
Visited with Governor L. Lincoln, his Class of 1802.
Visited the Chambers of R. Winthrop— J. S. C. Greene— Loring.
Took Coffee at the House of Professor Ware—
Rode with George to Mr P. C. Brooks’s at Medford. Missed our way— Arrived at 8. P.M.— Mr and Mrs Brooks, Abby and Miss Phillips.

div.p: 28. V:30. Prize Declamations. Φ.B.K.— Boston— Quincy
Conversation with Mr Brooks of Charles and Abby.
To Boston after Breakfast with George— Degrand, Sprague Jesse Putnam— Stephen White. G. Parkman— Harvard Monument for 26. September.
To Cambridge with George 1/2 past 10. Boylston prize Declamations begun— Davis— Senior— Sargent junr— Meriam Senr. and Tower juniors took the prize— Judges 1st. 11 then 9—
Φ.B.K. oration delivered by Jonathan Porter, who was unwell

Poem by Hedge— Pleasant Procession to Holworthy Hall. E. Everett President— Judge Story— G. Tucker— J. Carter of S.C J. W. Kittera— Dr. M’Vickar, Hammond of Vermont— Toasts, Music, Songs— Call at Professor Ware’s for George— Met Dr. Andrews of Newbury Port— Call at Dr. Hill’s— at Judge Lee’s where I saw Dr. and Mrs Waterhouse— To Boston with George— Then alone to Quincy— John and Charles had come out before— John unwell— T. B. Adams junr and Elizabeth returned from party at Cohassett.
Worn out with weariness.
29. V:30. Friday— Tide bath at one.

list.item: Beale— G. W— Charles went to Boston.
Woart— William— Letter from E. Cruft— A. Wood. Newby Port
Foster. Charles and Louisa.— Louisa C. Smith
Evening at G. W. Beale’s— John confined to his chamber

div.p: 30. VI. Saturday— Boston. Medford.

list.item: To Boston with Charles— Call at James H. Fosters
Mrs Dexters— Franklin and Mrs Dexter at Dr Welsh’s.
P. C. Brooks—jr. Edward— Sidney— Frothingham— Everett and Mrs.— Mr Stetson—
Papers from B. Vaughan— G. W. A. and Dr Welsh—

div.p: 31. V:30. Sunday.

list.item: He dined with us— Also Mr Furness
